poem:
**A Fiscal Reflection**

In the grey corridors of power,  
the chancellor ponders the nation's ache,  
a cycle of panic, like wind  
through neglected fields.  
Promises lean like brittle reeds;  
the tax's heavy hand,  
a stone on worn scales,  
while hearts, tethered to cold numbers,  
seek warmth in the sharp air  
of an unseeing dawn.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Rachel Reeves’s first budget offers a chance to break out of the doom loop. A pre-election budget with some distinctly dodgy looking tax cuts. All leaving an election-winning, but nevertheless very unpopular, government with a big fiscal hole to fill. What does the chancellor do? Put up taxes, of course.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
